info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 29 at 5:13PM CDT until June 29 at 11:15PM CDT by NWS Springfield MO
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of southwest Missouri, including the following counties, Christian and Greene.
* WHEN...Until 1115 PM CDT Sunday.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 513 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following low water crossings... Wilson's Creek at Old Limey Road, Finley River at Johns Ford Road, Parchcorn Creek at Smyrna Road, Wilson Creek at Farm Road 146, Clear Creek at Farm Road 87, Wilson Creek at Farm Road 156 and Green Valley Creek at Holder RD. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Springfield, Nixa, Ozark, Republic, Battlefield, Strafford, Willard, Clever, Sparta, Ash Grove, Fair Grove, Billings, Walnut Grove, Fremont Hills, Brookline, Glidewell, Galloway, Ebenezer, Turners, Bois D'arc, Boaz, Cave Springs, Sacville, Bassville, Linden and Oldfield. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1115 PM CDT THIS EVENING
